abstract.text: A task for handling timely Bluetooth alerts in the background.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: tasks to handle timely alerts in the background. Use these tasks to reconnect a peripheral and handle a critical alert. Apps that use timely alerts can also scan for a specific system identifier (UUID) while in the background. You can then perform the initial connection and pair the devices if necessary.
To receive timely alerts, your peripheral must use Generic Attribute Profile (GATT) transactions. Call
to enable notifications for the specified characteristic. Then, any changes to the peripheral’s characteristic wakes your app using a
task. Use this task to reconnect to the peripheral and handle the critical alert.
In watchOS 9 and later, SwiftUI Background tasks are the preferred way to handle background tasks and interactions. For more information,
The critical alerts and background scans share a budget. Your app can only use five timely alerts or background scans within a rolling 24-hour window.
When your app receives a timely alert and your budget has only one Bluetooth alert task remaining, the system raises a
error. If you exceed the budget, it raises a
error. The system passes these errors to your
If you exceed your budget, your app doesn’t receive any timely alerts until additional background budget becomes available. The user can reset this budget by launching your app.

abstract.text: Sets notifications or indications for the value of a specified characteristic.
A protocol that provides updates on the use of a peripheral’s services.
Tells the delegate that retrieving the specified characteristic’s value succeeded, or that the characteristic’s value changed.
Runs the specified action when the system provides a background task.
Build watchOS apps that use features the app delegate monitors or controls, such as background tasks and extended runtime sessions.
A task that updates your app’s state in the background.
A task for handling timely Bluetooth alerts in the background.
A background task used to update your app after a SiriKit intent runs.
The abstract superclass for WatchKit’s background task classes.
A background task used to periodically donate relevant Siri shortcuts.
A background task used to update your app’s user interface in preparation for a snapshot.
A task that responds to background URL sessions.
A background task used to receive background updates from the Watch Connectivity framework.
Provide a timely, accurate snapshot of your app by using snapshot background tasks.

doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/W.title: Preparing to take your watchOS app’s snapshot

abstract.text: Handle scheduled update tasks in the background, and respond to background system interactions including Siri intents and incoming Bluetooth messages.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
